Entry.2:
Granny Pincombes Birthday, age 79

Tuesday 2January 1917
Paid £1/8/8(40 Francs)
Entry.3:
Letter and New Year Card from Mrs. Lilliphant.
Went to Paris Plage, wet evening.
Entry.4: Letter & Diary from cousin Dolly. Letter from Mother dated
Entry.5:
Details of Jims Death. Letter to Flo, answered 24/2/17. Recd 15/4/17 P.Cs inseparate envelope.Sent P.C. to Miss Lilliphant.

Friday 5 January, 1917
Application for leave went to O/C Reinforcements today. Letter to Mother & also PCs in one envelope. P.C. to Polly P.C to Aunts Dolly & Annie.
Entry.6:
Flos Birthday.
Went to Etaples.
O/C Reinforcements wants to know have I been in England since Nov. 1915.
Entry.7:
Portuguese officers inspected the School.
Application for leave returned to D.A.A.G.
Entry.9:
January, 1917
Rain & sleet during night snow & rain in Day
No Parade.
Wrote to Aus. Base P.O. N.C.O. a/cRedirection.
Entry.10:
Cold, rain, snow & sleet all day
No Parade very cold.
Wrote to Flo.
Entry.12:
Letter from Polly.
Snow & cold.

Friday 12
Entry.13:
Cold & windy
Leave came through.
Cool & windy.

Saturday 13January, 1917
Letter from Flo. 14-11-16.
Letter from mother1-11-16.
Xmas Card from mother.
Entry.14:
Leave starts (10days)
Report at Etaples Station 5.45. A.M.Went to Calais, left E. 10 A.M. Arr. 4pm. Snowed during night,1 inch, snowing during day. 
snowing
Went to Rest Camp Beaumaris, No 1 Camp Calais. 3 inches snow everywhere.
Entry.16:
Left Calais 11 AM,arr. Boulogne 1.50 PM & went London 5 pm. Drew£9. Snow everywhere.

Tuesday 16
Entry.17:
Left for Torrington11 A.M. arr. 5pm.
Snowing in London.Olive met me at station.

Wednesday 17January, 1917
Went to the School and saw Mr. Hinde. Saw Mr Lilliphant & Mr Pearce. Went to Pictures with Olive & Miss Edwards.

Thursday 18Januiary, 1917
Went to Olives factory to see the machinery.
P.C. to mother, Flo, Kemp.
Answered13-3-17
Recd 6-5-17

Friday 19
Entry.18:
Went to Mr Lilliphants & had a good time. Wereall pleased to see me.
Told Flo of doings up to here.
Entry.20: Went to the Market. Slight snow. Saw Mrs Rew.
Entry.21:
Cold
Went to Parish Church.
Letter to Flow, answered 16.3.17, recd. 29-4-17,with two P.C's in. Went to see Bill Hartnall.
Have had a nice quiet holiday in Torringtonof 5 days.

Monday 22
Entry.22:
Returned to London 9.32, arrived 3.40.
Went to pictures
Entry.23:
Return to London
 Went to Pantomine Cinderella at London Opera House. Slept at King George & Queen Mary Club, Charing X Road.

Wednesday 24
Entry.24:
P.C. to mother & Flo
P.C. answered 13-3-17, Recd. 6-5-17
Leave finishes. Report at Victoria at 5-45 am today to Return to France on 25th. Arr. 11-30 AM. Field of snow.

Thursday 25
Entry.25:
Went to Whitehall, Westminster Abbey & United Services Museum.
Got new watch from New Oxford Street
Entry.26:
Arr. Camp 2pm.
Very cold. Ice 6 inches thick in Tank. Letter from Flo (30-10-16).Letter from Olive & Mrs Rogers
Entry.27:
Very cold still.
Capt. Atkinson went sick.

Sunday 28 January, 1917
Book of Westminster Abbey to Flo.
3 envelopes of P.C. to Flo - answered
1 P. C.to Flo - answered
1 letterto Flo - answered

envelopes P. C. to mother - answered.
Cold

1.8.8

Wrote to Hdqrs re return or Staff duty in London
.
Last night 12 degrees of Frost. Cold & windy.Heavy frost.

Letter to Aunt Polly
Letter toMrs Lilliphant
Arr. Egypt 1915 2 years ago
Cold & Snowing
Entry.34:
Heavy frost last night, bread is frozen hard.
Granny died.
Boots frozen stiff every morning, went to Paris Plage.

Saturday 3
Entry.35:
Not so cold.
Went to Gordon Hut.
Wrote to mother.
America broke off Diplomatic Relations with Germany

Sunday 4February, 1917
Cold wind & overcast.
America Declared War





Monday 5
Entry.36: inches of snow last night & snowing hard all day. P.C. to Flo, answer letter to Flo, answer.
Entry.37: Cold still. Windy, snow heavy on ground.Orchestra at Walton Hut very good. Played the Barcarolle from Hoffman.

February, 1917
Cold E Wind.
Went to pictures
Entry.39:
Cold S.E. Wind.
Recd Pair of socks from Torrington boys Parcel Committee.

Letter to A.D.P.S (4th since 5-9-16). Letter to A. Vellacott re socks.
Slightly warmer
Entry.41:
Went to Paris-Plage.
Not so cold.
Aeroplane had to descend through engine trouble.

Letter from Flo Xmas Eve.Letter from mother 13-12-16.

Pay 1/8/8.
Letter from Flo (10 pages) dated Xmas & Boxing Day.

Chilly & still Hazy.

.

Warm.

Leave for Boulogne tomorrow.

Start08-33 am.
Return train21-05 pm.
Overcast - on Pass to Boulogne.
Visited Cathedral. Went to Pictures in Municipal Theatre. Slight rain.
Weigh 59 Kilos (9 stone4) in walking out dress.

Monday28 May 1917
Left Boulogne 4 pm, arr.5-30,great reception at Victoria. Moved to another Billet. Left Boulogne 4 pm,arr. Folkestone 10-45.

June, 1917
Back to London, went to Pictures.

Entry.189:
Letter to mother.
Pulled out from North Dkyardnoon & anchored in Sound near Breakwater.
Went to confession.

Sunday 29
Entry.190:
Still in Plymouth Sound.
Received Sea Kit Bag from Red Cross.
Cleared Breakwater, 9.7 pm.
Escort. T.B.D. 60.9045.92. H.M. Aus. cruiser Marmora
Mass on Poop deck. Recd Holy Communion & served the mass.

Monday 30
Entry.191:
Sea steady, mod. warm. Appointed ships signaller.

Tuesday 31
Entry.192: Fairly Smooth, light wind. 8 to 12 watch. 8 - midnight. Escort left us 7-30 pm.
Entry.193:
Passed steamers (4)
Clear getting warmer.
Bridge 8 - 12 & 8 - 12.
Getting warmer & clearer sky.
Entry.195:
Cooler.
Passed 2 Sail & one steamer.
Wonderful bright Moon. Full tonight.
Entry.198:
Wind, cool, sun warm.
Sea like Mediterranean today. Funeral on "Devon". Keepwatch under bridge 8-12 am,8-12 pm.

Saturday 4August, 1917
Overcast. Moderately warm. Busy.
War declared by England 1914.
Passed one ship.
S.O.S.from "Mahronda", 22.44.N - 52.23.W. Submarinechasing & shelling.

Sunday 5August, 1917
Steamer Passed Port Quarter
Forenoon watch. Forenoon & First watch.



Monday 6August, 1917
Finished Zig Zag course.
Officers in white ducks.Paid £1.
8-12 & 6-8 watch.

Tuesday 7August, 1917
Hazy & dull.
Letter to Aunt Polly. P.C. to Kemps & Mrs Lilliphant.
4 - 8. 4 - 6 Sea exceptionally smooth.

Wednesday 8August, 1917
12 - 4,12 - 4, 8 - 12
Warm, clear. Sea smooth Life Belts discarded.
Entry.199: Rained during8 - 12 & 6 - 8, night cloudy, mod. Wind Heavy rain squalls during day.
Entry.200:
August, 1917
Cloudy. Sighted Sierra Leone shortly after 9 AM. Showery during night. 
15 - 4 & 12 - 4 & 8 - 12.
Arr. in Harbour 2pm. 4 - 8 & 4 - 6.
Entry.201:
Showery still.12-4 & 12-4 & 8-12.
Niggers in very narrow boats selling fruit & diving for money.
Suevic,Borda&Beltana, in port.

Sunday 12August, 1917
EscortHMS Africa (Battleship).
Showery. Left Siera Leone 11 AM. Convoy of 9 ships bound N. 8-12 & 6-8.
Heavy downpour of rain on clearing Freetown. So heavy could not see ship 200 yds ahead. Heaviest rain I have ever seen.
Entry.203:
12 - 4 & 12 - 4 & 8 - 12.
First death. An R.C. Artilleryman. Helped priest at funeral, died about 2.00 am, buried just before ten am. No rain, windy from S.E.

Wednesday 15
Entry.204:
Mod. windy.
8 - 12 & 6 - 8.
Crossed line noon.
Clearer & no rain.
Saw Southern cross for First time in S.W.

Thursday 16
Entry.205:
- 8 & 4 - 6.
Windy from S. by E.

Friday 17
Entry.207:
Windy - 8 - 12 & 6 - 8.
Ship signaller had photo taken.

Sunday 19August, 1917
4 - 8 & 4 - 6.
Went to Mass on boat deck.

Monday 20August, 1917
12 - 4 & 12 - 4 & 8 - 12.
Very windy. Sea choppy. Roughest day yet. S.E. wind still blowing, it is
 trade wind
hereabout.

Tuesday 21August, 1917
Cold & windy, coldest day out.
8 - 12 & 4 - 8.

Wednesday 22
Entry.208:
No 19. Sig. J. Lawrence, 18th Battalion.
Jim Killed 1915, Hill 60 Suvla.
4 - 8 & 4 - 6.
Cold in night watches.
Entry.209:
August,1917
12 - 4,12 - 4, 8 - 12.
Cold and overcast.
Letter to Flo & mother.
Wheat- oats &c. - corn to I.C.S.



Friday 24
Entry.210:
- 12 & 6 - 8.
Letter to O.C. Verne re telescope.
Weather clearing.

Saturday 25
Entry.211:
- 8 & 4 - 6.
Strong wind Cold, wearing life belts again.

Sunday 26
Entry.213:
- 4, 12 - 4, 8 - 12.
Went to Mass.
Clear Sky Cold wind.
ships
 Doctor Taken on boardHMS Africa. Both ships hove to. Case of meningitis on "Africa". Afine sight.
Entry.215:
- 12 Bridge
Arrived Cape Town daylight. Pulled into dock8.15 AM, calm day. Saw Willie Lennie & Mr. Barham of Oakleys. Reptd. to C.S.A. at Drill Hall. Sailed 1.30.
Entry.216:
Cold, Raining.
Paid 10/-.
Life Belts off again. Ship rolling a bit.

Wednesday 29
Entry.217:
Rough wind & sea. Rolling a good deal. Hugging the coast all day.

Thursday 30
Entry.218:
Cloudy smooth sea, Arr. off Durban 8.30 AM. Tied up 11-15 AM. Coaling.
Went ashore at Durban.
Letter & P.C. to Flo. Heavy rain after dark.
Entry.219:
Coaling Ship.
Light rain. Went ashore. Visited beach. Heavy swell & big waves great sight. Tea Concert & Supper at Wesley Hall.
Letter 
& P.C.
 to Flo, P.C. to mother.
pulled out 10-15 AM Sailed 5.30pm

Windy - choppy sea.
Entry.222:
Windy & Raining.
Rolling & pitching a bit. Went to Mass. Wrote answers to Principles of breeding.





Monday 3September, 1917
Bit windy, rolling a little.
Entry.223:
Rolling 
less
 still, clearer Sky. Wind strong from S.E. 
N of A
 chilly.
Entry.224: Cold very choppy sea. Rolling & pitching a good deal during night. Wind changed to S.W. during night. Very cold. Hailstones.
Entry.225: Still cold & windy & rolling & pitching a lot.
Entry.227: Not so cold. Ship near at 8 AM.
Entry.228:
Slight Rain, not so cold.
Went to Mass.
Rougher towards evening.
Wrote answers to Swine equipment & types & breeds of Swine.
Entry.229:
Very Rough, windy & raining.
Posted on A64. I.C.S. Lessons Feeding, Breeding, Pig equipment & types of Swine.
Ship posted 
70 
miles Today .
Entry.230:
Heavy wind, sea, rain.
Pitching very heavy again.
Medical Inspection.
Entry.231:
September, 1917
Going due east, weather finer, sea & wind not so rough.
Entry.232:
Cold, calmer.
Letter to Flo.
Short Arm inspection.
Hail Storm at Dusk.
Entry.234:
Enlisted 1914.
Fine, Calmer., Still cold.

Saturday 15
Entry.235:
Finer, not so cold, sea & wind much less now.
Went to Confession.

Sunday 16September,1917
1000 days service
overseas.
Went to Mass & Communion.
Wind a little stronger.

Monday 17
Entry.236:
1000 days out of Australia
Heavy wind & 
slight
rain not so cold now. Pitching, heavy sea rough.

Tuesday 18
Entry.237:
Arr. Fremantle10-15 AM.
Left Fremantle 2-30 PM.
Big Strike on in Australiafor last month. General throughout Australia.
Sandwiches & cakes from Red Cross. Raining.

Wednesday 19
Entry.239: In the Bight,sea & wind better, bit warmer, some sunshine.
Entry.240:
Calmest day yet since Durban, warmer.

Saturday 22
Entry.241: Calm & smooth sea, moderately warm, slight showers.
Entry.242:
Smooth sea, light wind, cloudy.
Paid £1.
Passed Cape Otway
light about 9 PM.



Monday 24
Entry.243:
Heavy rain after landing.
Arr. Melbourne 2 AM. Tied up 10 AM.
Saw Flo as I came off Pier in motor car. Went to Flo's House, saw mothers & Brother.
Went to 5 A.G.H at 2 pm.
Entry.244: Finer. 24 hours leave. Went to Show with Flo. Went for a walk after. Stayed at Flo's House for the night.
Entry.245:
Report at 5 A.G.H. 10 AM.
Went to Flo's House in afternoon. Spent PM at House & Evening atSt. K. 
Made all arrangements for marriage.
Entry.246:
Sailed 12.15 pm on Euripides (A 14).
Cleared Melb. Head after 4 pm.
Entry.248:
Arr. Sydney Heads 6.30 AM.
Disembarked at 9.30 am.
Mother & Paddy met me at Domain. Heavy thunderstorm off heads in Morning.
Paid £2.
Entry.250:
Heard band at 
Domain
 Gardens.
Not feeling well.
Big Procession of children.
Entry.251:
October, 1917
8 Hour Day.
Did not go anywhere.
Letter from Flo, letter to Flo & wire to Flo.
Entry.252:
Letter from Flo, P.C. toher. Went to Lands & Irrigation Dept.
Letter to Flo.
Entry.254:
Paid 14/-/5.
Left for Melb. 7.25 pm. Big thunderstorm near Wagga.

Thursday 4October, 1917
Arr. Melb 12-51.
Flo met me. Heavy rain. Arranged for wedding.
Entry.255: Bought Ring & fixed time of marriage. Saw Mrs Coghlan & other relatives.
Entry.256:
October, 1917
Married at S. H. church, Preston at 10 am, Frank Best Man. Dororthy (cousin of Bride) Bridesmaid. Frank & Mrs Ryan witnesses.
Entry.257:
Went to Hampton for 4 days Honeymoon.
Went to Sandringham for a walk in Evening.
Am Very Happy.
Rained in morning, cold day.
Entry.258:
Fine day. Went for a walk in Morn & afternoon. Bought our first piece of furniture, a picture.
Pictures in evening.
Entry.260:
Returned to Preston.
Jim Ryan Died about 9.30 pm.

Wednesday 10October, 1917
Went to Mass for Jim Ryan. Wire to mother. Leave extensionapplied fortill 19th. Changed train tickets. Allotment 3/6 a day to Flo Starts.
Entry.261: Jim Ryan buried at 3.40pm in Melb. Gen. Cemetary.Letter to Mother.
Entry.264:
Went toNorthley's & St Kilda. Dull night. Slight Rain after dark.

Sunday 14
Entry.265:
Went to Mass. Rain in Morning.

Monday 15October, 1917
Sydney Express 5pm
Spencer Street.
Went to Mortuary Mass for Jim Ryan. Left for Sydney with Flo.
Entry.266: Arr. Sydney 11-5 AM & went straight Home.
Entry.267: Went for walk in City with Flo.
Entry.268: Went to city & Pictures with Flo.
Entry.269:
Arr. Anzac 1915 2nd occasion
Admitted 4 A.G.H Randwick. 

Saturday 20 October, 1917
Arr. Anzac 2nd occasion 1915.
Went to Randwick with Flo.

Sunday 21
Entry.270: Anniversary of Father's Death. Killed by Accident
Entry.271:
Went to Mass with Flo.



Monday 22
Entry.272:
Saw Medical Officer for Discharge.
Left 4 A.G.H.Put in application for Pension.

Tuesday 23October, 1917
Went out with Flo.

Wednesday24October. 1018
Put in


Thursday 25
Entry.274: Put in application for land at Clinton, Inverell.
Entry.275: Received Brown Scapular from Flo's Aunt in a Tassy convent.
Entry.279: Sick. Stayed in Bed all day.
Entry.280: Recd Pass to go to Inverell to inspect Land. Recd Telescope. Letter from G.S.M. to Rept. to Liverpool Camp for Exam for Instruction Staff at 9 am5/11/17.
Entry.281:
arr. Inverell

Left for Inverell to inspect R.S.S. at Clinton. Heard good reports of place from two different men on train.
Entry.282:
Arr. Inverell.
Inspected Clinton Seems a good Place
Arr. Inverell & proceeded to Clinton.
Entry.285:
November, 1917
Arr. Sydney 6.35 AM. Went to church at Waverley.
Entry.286: Went to Lands Dept. & was approved for a Settler.
Entry.287:
November, 1917
Nothing doing.
Letter from Mrs Lilliphant, wrote to Mrs. Cowie re Mrs McArthurs House.
Entry.288: Discharged from A.I.F. 3 years 54 days service of which 2 yrs 281 days abroad.
Entry.290:
Pension starts.
Shopping, an expensive game with a wife.

Friday 9November, 1917
Letter from Mr. Cowie
Letterto cousin Polly
Letter to Mrs Lilliphant
Letter toToowoomba acknowling receipt of Telescope.
Under Sec. Agric. for Bulletinsetc.
Entry.292:
November, 1917
Went to Mrs McCullogh and WaverleyR.C. Church to 40 hour Adoration.
Entry.293:
Recd. articles from
Running around Govt. offices as usual.
Entry.295:
Recd. articles from Repatriation.

Wednesday 14November, 1917
Advised of pension of 15/- for self & 7/6 for wife per fortnight.
Signed agreement to go to Clinton R.S.S
Entry.300: Arr. Inverell & went to old hut on Beaulieu.
Entry.301: Started work on Beaulieu. Warm. Put fence round house.
Entry.302:
Met Flo on Princes Bridge 1914.
James Ryan's (Flo's Father's) Birthday
Worked on vines. Wrote to Commissioner for Railways.
Entry.303:
Rained.
Fortified wine & added clarifier.

Friday 23November, 1917
First time Flo & I went out 
together 
1914. D.A.P. ConcertDomain Camp Melb. 
Went to town for Furniture. Pension
Entry.306:
Went to Mr Fry's House & Flo was shown round orchard.
Chipping vines
Entry.307:
First time Flo & I went for a walk by ourselves.We went to
 St. K.
 the Alexandra Gardens.
Picking Cherries.

Tuesday 27
Entry.308:
Two storms last night. Storm & Hail today. Vines sprayed & some Sulphured.
Cooler.
Entry.310: Scarifying garden, ploughing weeds in vines. Warm.
Entry.312:
Joe Ryan died 1915.
Warm, ploughing in weeds in vines.
Entry.313:
Ploughing vines. Very hot. Finished cutting hay. Big storm, cloudy in evening.
Letter from Railway Commissioner.
Entry.314:
December, 1917
Rain in Evening, hot morning.
Mr Fry & Mr McDonald inspected house.
Entry.315:
Sent (per Mr Fry) requisition for stove & window glass.
Rain in Evening.
Tying Vines. & Hilling Corn.
Entry.320:
Trimming Vines.
Took Flo to town.

Saturday 8
Entry.321:
Minister for Lands & Mr Bryant & Party Inspected Beaulieu.
Showery & Thundery all the week.

Sunday 9
Entry.322:
Visited Clinton with Flo.
Warm& Sultry.



Monday 10December, 1917
Packing Lemons & Peaches & took them to Clinton.
Paid 5/18/0.
Letters to Dep. Agr. re Gazette.
Entry.323:
Letter to Frank & Aunt Boyd (Flo).
Carting hay Fornoon. Heavy Rain Afternoon.
Entry.324:
December, 1917
Heavy Rain all day.
Made Pigeon Holes Medicine Chest & Bookshelf.
Entry.325:
Proposed to Flo at St Kilda 1914.
Letter to Paymaster & S.O.1 & R.S.
Town & Country journals & I.C.S.in.
Balloted for Blocks.
Entry.328:
Went over my Block (No. 201) with Flo.



Monday 17
Entry.330:
Trimming Vines & making out schedules.

Wednesday 19
Entry.331:
Gave schedule & Requisition to Mr Smith.
Picking Peaches,chipping garden.

Thursday 20
Entry.332:
years since last saw Flo.
Picking Peaches etc

Referendum day. We did not vote, could not go in.

Friday 21
Entry.333: Took Flo to town & bought bed (8/8/-)
Entry.336:
Got bed from Inverell.
Hot,storm in Evening.
Xmas card from Bernhard.

Tuesday 25
Entry.337:
Good dinner, went for walk. Flo sick.
Heavy rain in morning.
Entry.338:
Storm in Evening.
Planted first vegetables.
Entry.340:
Thrown out of Cart. Head, leg & arm hurt.
Rain in Evening.

Saturday 29
Entry.341:
Letter from I.C.S.,Mother, also 2 Xmas cards.
Very hot.

Sunday 30
Entry.343:
Theo Hagen 21st Birthday.
Clinton Men came to Beaulieu, 4 in cart drunk, two or more hurt. Too much wine.
